file_content.text: Now if only you could do something about the weather....
Master Sav is dead. I found him in the ice fortress and cut him down.
Then the Brotherhood will be broken. Their cult of personality has lost its savior.
I will contact Dorn Base to send supplies to us. It won't be long before we clear out the Brotherhood's remnants.
Master Sav is dead, and his successor is leaving for another planet. I trust this will help.
You are a drink of water to a dying man. Yes, yes, it will help us greatly.
I'm contacting Dorn Base. They should be able to bring us supplies if the Brotherhood is truly leaving the mountain passes.
But Master Sav was just one of many. Soon we'll go after the big game: Boss Undro, Ellis Tarn and the other White Maw kingpins.
How do I get in on this?
Sign me up.
Admiral Holtz is going to order an attack on key White Maw members, but I don't know when or how.
Never heard of them.
Who?
That's how they like it. Low profile. But Intelligence has worked up a list of their names. Admiral Holtz is going to order an attack.
I've got enough scars from your ideas. Don't try to rope me into more.
I've done enough for you.
No, no, I'm barely involved. But Admiral Holtz is supposed to be putting together a final assault on key White Maw figures.
Fixer 308 at Zerek Outpost would have the details. The outpost's in the ship graveyard, prime White Maw turf.
If anyone's come up with a way to hammer the pirates right off this rock, the Fixer would know. Give her a try.
Look at the misery here. Then bring that misery to the Brotherhood.
The Hailstorm Brotherhood make camp in an open-air fortress cut out of the ice not far from here. I guess caves were too easy.
They obey what their beloved Master Sav tells them to. He's their legend, a man who can survive anywhere.
Kill the head of their little personality cult, and the body will fall apart.
What sorts of things has this "master" survived?
How unkillable is Sav?
A few poisoning attempts, walking on lava on Mustafar and fighting just about everybody on Hoth at one time or another.
He's got "master" in his name... is he on the Jedi Council, or is it just a nickname?
Is Master Sav a Jedi?
We assume he doesn't use the Force, or else he wouldn't be able to teach his skills to so many.
He's tapped into something in the human body which makes him and his followers plenty dangerous.
If you go into that ice fortress, don't give him any chances.
I'm up to the task.
Then you're taking on the right maniac. Sav's fought just about everyone and everything on Hoth at one time or another.
Even when his men were killed at the Battle of High Ridge, he lived in the snow, hunting wampas with a spear made from an icicle.
Three weeks later, he strolled back to the ice fortress, none the worse. So if you see him... don't give him any chances.
Criminals, no matter how hardy, will not defy our Empire.
As the Empire requires.
Good. Once he and his followers are scattered, we'll be able to get what we need shipped here from Dorn Base.
Until then, we'll hold out. There's no way this filth will win through attrition.
The more you talk about this guy, the higher the bounty gets.
He sounds expensive.
If I sent you in saying he was a soft target, chances are you wouldn't come back alive.
I like killing cultists. It makes me feel like I'm tidying up the galaxy.
This ought to be fun.
Agreed. But I have one final request.
Done.
Good. Now to work.
Master Sav is responsible for this. For me, for my men.....
When you kill him, you let him know what a mistake he made leaving me alive.
I found the Hailstorm Brotherhood you spoke of. The pass is clear.
Is that so? Glad to hear their bodies are finally getting colder.
Those maniacs have laughed at us for far too long. But here's something they don't know--we found out where they hide.
The sooner the Brotherhood loses some lives, the happier I'll be.
Please return to the medical bay. You may further injure yourself by walking.
I heard you the first five times. Now be silent, I have an outpost to defend.
So, you made it past the pass in the mountains. I'm surprised the Hailstorm Brotherhood let anyone through.
You speak as if we are familiar. We aren't.
Who are you?
I'm sorry. It's just good to see a new Imperial face. Captain Eth, at your service.
Your old friend is alive and well. Hoth is turning our way.
Captain Revar says hello.
Revar... it is too long since I've heard from him. Apparently not doing so well he could send a fighting force.
It was nothing special.
Survival itself is to be celebrated around here.
We've been cut off from the other outposts by the Hailstorm Brotherhood, a cult of madmen in the White Maw pirates.
Who's in this "brotherhood," exactly?
Never heard of this bunch.
They're a cult within the White Maw pirates. Humans from some other ice planet that test themselves living in the cold.
They survive in the snow even better than the Talz, and they've cut us off from any hope of supplies.
You see this wound? Dressed it with seasonings from the rations when we ran out of kolto. In a few days, we'll be eating boot leather to survive.
There's no glory in dying. Can you make it back to another outpost?
Should you retreat?
No retreating. I've spent too long in this ice patch to be driven off by some half-dressed freaks. Besides, they'd track us and attack.
Are you going to take this indignity from a handful of pirates?
This is intolerable.
We're weaker from hunger than I'd like to say. They're starving us out, and it's working.
One defeat would be our last. What about you? Could you face them?
How do we fight back?
It's a simple one, but those are the easiest to execute.
The Hailstorm Brotherhood are lying in wait in a pass between hills near here. You may be able to find them and wipe them out.
Could you do this? Could you face the Brotherhood?
I will do more than face them. The snow will melt with their blood.
Easily.
Yes! Let not one of them stand, or crawl, or limp away. They will face retribution for those they have killed.
I will break their ranks, and send them screaming.
It poses no difficulty.
Yes. Turn their ambush against them and cut them down as they flee.
You've hired yourself a hunter.
If you pay, sure.
Good. We will see how they fare when someone else has the advantage of surprise.
They'll never know what hit them.
I can and will.
Good. Bleed them white so that any who find the bodies know the might of the Empire.
I can try.
Every brother you can find, put in the ground. They may try to surround you, so watch out.
Then, when you have the bodies piled--ack! Curse it, another stitch.
Sir, I did say you need to be on bed rest....
Very well. The Brotherhood like to use downed speeders as bait. They should be easy enough to find. Good hunting.
If your men are too weak to fight, retreat is the only option.
No. [Refuse quest]
Say what you will. I am not leaving until I impale these madmen on a spit.
My concern is with the Hailstorm Brotherhood.
